oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Holly Ridge Cemetery: wreath at grave of Willie James Foster
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of the grave of Willie James Foster. His gravestone reads:"Harmonica parader with soul. Sept. 19, 1921 - May 20, 2001. A photograph of foster is mounted on the gravestone above his name. A wreath with blue and white flosers stands behind the grave.

Holly Ridge Cemetery, located in the heart of the Mississippi Delta, received the first of many historical markers erected to mark the Mississippi Blues Trail. The cemetery includes the grave of Charley Patton, who is considered one of the earliest performers in Delta blues tradition.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Graveposts; Cemeteries;
Cemeteries
